required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Single-Blind, Placebo-Controlled, Dose-Ranging Trial of Oral HDV-Insulin in Patients With Type 2 Diabetes Mellitus
clinical_study.official_title: A Single-Blind, Placebo-Controlled, Dose-Ranging Trial of Oral HDV-Insulin in Patients With Type 2 Diabetes Mellitus

brief_summary.textblock: A study designed to determine the appropriate doses of Oral HDV Insulin at meal times.

primary_outcome.measure: Dose response of postprandial plasma glucose to escalated doses of oral HDV-insulin
primary_outcome.description: To determine the dose response of postprandial plasma glucose to escalating doses (increased daily) of Oral HDV-Insulin given as single doses before breakfast, lunch and dinner, in addition to the Diabetes Mellitus (DM) subject's regular oral type 2 therapy

primary_outcome.measure: Daily glucodynamic profile of Oral HDV-Insulin
primary_outcome.description: To compare the daily glucodynamic profile of Oral HDV-Insulin over the treatment days

study_pop.textblock: Have a current diagnosis of type 2 DM, which is currently managed with oral hypoglycemic agents for at least 3 months
